docs.abstract: The company is spending more to promote the iPhone than it is on ads for ‘The Morning Show’ and other programs on Apple TV Plus.
docs.snippet: The company is spending more to promote the iPhone than it is on ads for ‘The Morning Show’ and other programs on Apple TV Plus.
docs.lead_paragraph: Show business may be Apple’s latest big experiment — but it is not the company’s top priority.

headline.main: Behind Apple’s ‘Slow-Roll’ Marketing Push for Its New Streaming Service
headline.print_headline: Behind the ‘Slow-Roll’ Marketing Push for Apple TV Plus

docs.abstract: Until Friday, few executives had complained in public about how Google, Apple, Amazon and Facebook hurt their businesses.
docs.snippet: Until Friday, few executives had complained in public about how Google, Apple, Amazon and Facebook hurt their businesses.
docs.lead_paragraph: For all the criticisms directed at the largest tech companies in the last couple of years, few smaller rivals have been willing to speak up publicly.

headline.main: Please Stop Big Tech, Small Rivals Tell Lawmakers

docs.abstract: The Silicon Valley giant is preparing for a legal fight over encryption, even as it works to reduce tensions with the Justice Department.
docs.snippet: The Silicon Valley giant is preparing for a legal fight over encryption, even as it works to reduce tensions with the Justice Department.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple is privately preparing for a legal fight with the Justice Department to defend encryption on its iPhones while publicly trying to defuse the dispute, as the technology giant navigates an increasingly tricky line between its customers and the Trump administration.

headline.main: Apple Takes a (Cautious) Stand Against Opening a Killer’s iPhones
headline.print_headline: U.S. Request for Access to Gunman’s Phone Data Puts Apple in Bind

byline.original: By Jack Nicas and Katie Benner

docs.abstract: Plaintiffs argued that the technology giant had used its monopoly power to raise the prices of iPhone apps.
docs.snippet: Plaintiffs argued that the technology giant had used its monopoly power to raise the prices of iPhone apps.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday allowed an enormous antitrust class action against Apple to move forward, saying consumers should be allowed to try to prove that the technology giant had used monopoly power to raise the prices of iPhone apps.

headline.main: Supreme Court Allows Antitrust Lawsuit Against Apple to Proceed
headline.print_headline: Antitrust Lawsuit Against Apple  Clears Hurdle at Supreme Court

byline.original: By Adam Liptak and Jack Nicas

docs.abstract: Because nothing is just a gadget anymore.
docs.snippet: Because nothing is just a gadget anymore.
docs.lead_paragraph: The optimistic view of the last 10 years of consumer technology is that hundreds of millions of people used unbelievable new devices and services to take part in explosive new economies and cultures.

docs.abstract: Despite regulatory scrutiny and pressure from lawmakers, the industry’s wealthiest are continuing to grow at remarkable speeds for big companies.
docs.snippet: Despite regulatory scrutiny and pressure from lawmakers, the industry’s wealthiest are continuing to grow at remarkable speeds for big companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Google’s parent company, Alphabet, said on Monday that revenue at the company soared past $161 billion last year, it was a stark reminder of the widening gap between tech’s wealthiest outfits and the rest of the industry.

headline.main: The Gap Between the Haves and Have-Nots of Tech Widens
headline.print_headline: Tech Giants’ Dominance Grows, Leaving Crumbs for the Rest

byline.original: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Matt Phillips

docs.abstract: Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg and Google’s Sundar Pichai have journeyed to Brussels as the European Union drafts regulation for A.I. and the digital economy.
docs.snippet: Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg and Google’s Sundar Pichai have journeyed to Brussels as the European Union drafts regulation for A.I. and the digital economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — First came Sundar Pichai, the chief executive of Google’s parent company, Alphabet. Then Apple’s senior vice president for artificial intelligence, John Giannandrea, showed up.

headline.main: Silicon Valley Heads to Europe, Nervous About New Rules
headline.print_headline: Tech’s Titans Head to Europe, Jittery About New A.I. Rules

docs.abstract: When you’re cutting and pasting, dragging the cursor over selected text and performing other common computer tasks, you can thank him.
docs.snippet: When you’re cutting and pasting, dragging the cursor over selected text and performing other common computer tasks, you can thank him.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawrence Tesler, a pioneering computer scientist who helped make it easier for users to interact with computers, whether cutting and pasting text or selecting text by dragging a cursor through it, died on Sunday at his home in Portola Valley, Calif. He was 74.

headline.main: Lawrence Tesler, Who Made Personal Computing Easier, Dies at 74
headline.print_headline: Lawrence Tesler, 74, Dies; Simplified Computer Use With Cut-Paste Function

docs.abstract: Trade officials approved the company’s request to remove tariffs on the Apple Watch.
docs.snippet: Trade officials approved the company’s request to remove tariffs on the Apple Watch.
docs.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — U.S. trade officials removed tariffs on the Apple Watch, the latest Apple device to avoid the United States-China trade war that had once looked like a dire threat to the company’s business.

headline.main: Trump Administration Gives Apple More Tariff Relief

docs.abstract: Mercantilism for the era of global value chains
docs.snippet: Mercantilism for the era of global value chains
docs.lead_paragraph: At this point, it’s looking as if Trump’s tough talk on China trade will turn out to be as empty as his tough talk on, say drug prices. Faced with the prospect of actually going toe to toe with powerful interests – as opposed to doing harm to desperate immigrants, poor people who need health care, etc. – Trump keeps backing down, ignominiously. But what happened to all that bluster about trade wars being “good, and easy to win”?

headline.main: Why a Trade War With China Isn’t ‘Easy to Win’ (Slightly Wonkish)
